goals__remit:
1. To effectively disseminate information and knowledge to the Palestinian society. This requires existence of systems to collect, analyze and report data and information that are most beneficial to the Palestinian society. In this case, preparing and producing appropriate reports on activities of ARIJ and involvement of the community should be available on a regular basis.  
 
2. To actively participate in identification and understanding of the community problems. This needs steady contact and communication between ARIJ and the community, through awareness programs, including workshops, reports, meetings, questionnaires, newsletters, volunteering work and assistance, etc.  
 
3. To identify and adapt the most appropriate technology to the needs and requirements of the community and the society.  
 
4. To achieve socio-economic development, through providing better access to food, and better management and utilization of land, water, and natural resources. 
 
5. To develop assessment and protection actions for Palestinian environment including biodiversity, water, soil and air. 
 
6. To play an active role in the development of the human resources needed to adapt and use technologies. In this regard, trained personnel should provide knowledge and experience to those untrained. 
 
7. To generate and attract income-producing opportunities for the community through technology transfer and through encouraging teamwork between scientists of the various institutions.   
 
8. To catalyze coordination and cooperation between the various groups and institutions working in economic development, and to facilitate the creation of a multi-sector planning unit.
relevant_communication:
ARIJ has been disseminating its broad range of expertise within the local, regional and international arenas. ARIJ provides technical and professional support for a diverse range of fields through its implementation of various developmental projects, research projects and consultancies on both the national and international levels. These fields include: Agriculture, Biodiversity, Food Security, Socioeconomic, Geoinformatics, Urbanization Monitoring, Physical Planning, Water, Environment, Information Technology and Systems, Alternative and Renewable Energy, Human Rights, Good Governance and Advocacy.  
 
ARIJ receives grants from the European Union under different programs namely: 
 
Horizon 2020 Programme 
6th and 7th Research Framework Programme - Research and Innovation 
Life-Third Countries Programme 
ENPI CBC MED Programme 
European Commission Humanitarian Aid Program (ECHO); 
EU Partnership for Peace Programme 
Non State Actors and Local Authorities in Development 
Supporting the Southern Neighbourhood Partnership cities in the implementation of Sustainable Urban Demonstration Energy Projects (SUDEP) 
amongst others 
 
Furthermore, ARIJ follows the EU Project Management guidelines, Visibility Manual as well as the Practical Guide  (PRAG). 
 
All Information is published on our website: www.arij.org.
